definition: to kill/to get rid of/(sports) to defeat/to eliminate

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance

to fall/to drop/to lag behind/to lose/to go missing/to reduce/fall (in prices)/to lose (value, weight etc)/to wag/to swing/to turn/to change/to exchange/to swap/to show off/to shed (hair)/(used after certain verbs to express completion, fulfillment, removal etc)
to cut weeds and eliminate the roots (idiom); to destroy root and branch/to eliminate completely
see 連鍋端|连锅端 [lian2 guo1 duan1]
to be fair/to be impartial/to settle (a matter etc)
(of a surgeon) to perform an operation/(of a patient) to have an operation/to decapitate/to behead/to single out as a point of attack
to kill sb to prevent them from divulging a secret/to silence sb
to impute/to shift the blame onto someone else
to run off rebuffed/to fend off/(to fight off and make sb) run off
to tear down/to destroy/to dismantle (a gang)/to abort (a fetus)
to root out/to eradicate/to sweep away/to abolish
strike first and gain the upper hand (idiom, martial arts term); Making the first move is an advantage.
